result.execSummary:
The defendant Allan M Rischman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With credit for 3 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank to be paid over the duration of probation failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
The court ordered the defendant to pay all costs and surcharges over the duration of probation and failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

NO CONTACT ORDER REMAINS.
The defendant is not to work or volunteer with children under the age of 16.
Defendant to undergo a sexual offender evaluation.

timeConds.notes:
With electronic monitoring. The defendant is allowed to leave the house for medical appointments for him and his wife.  
The defendant has a report date of 1.15.16 before 12 pm

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allan M Rischman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: The defendant's request for release privileges is granted.   The defendant may be released for Elder Care.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Thomas J. McAdams, Br. 7, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se letter for elder care/release on electronic monitoring.

Defendant Allan M Rischman in court with attorney Steven Richard Kohn.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS, with credit for 3 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  The court did not address if the defendant was eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 5 YEARS with the following conditions:  
*Serve 1 year in the House of Correction with electronic monitoring. The defendant is allowed to leave the house for medical appointments for him and his wife.  
The defendant has a report date of 1.15.16 before 12 pm.
NO CONTACT ORDER REMAINS.
Defendant to undergo a sexual offender evaluation.  The defendant is not to work or volunteer with children under the age of 16.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank to be paid over the duration of probation failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
The court ordered the defendant to pay all costs and surcharges over the duration of probation and failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Sentencing Referral Form.
Oral No Contact Order with children under the age of 16.
Parties are unable to appear on 12-18-2015. Case adjourned for 01-12-2016 at 08:30 am for Sentencing in Branch 7.

Defendant Allan M Rischman in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 7 due to the defendant's wife being terminally ill.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 12-18-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Allan M Rischman in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 25.
As to the charged offense:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of NO CONTEST.  Defendant advised must register as a sex offender and may be subject to Chapter 990 filings.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Parties waive PSI.
All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7,  in Room 620 of the Safety Building.
Case is adjourned for sentencing on 8-27-2015 at 8:30am Branch 7.
Branch 25 is in jury trial and is not able to hear this matter. Branch 38 will hear the matter on behalf of Branch 25. Parties notified.
Letter from attorney Kohn received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Received and Filed, Notice of Motion and Motion to Introduce Other Acts Evidence with attachments.

Defendant Allan M Rischman in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  ADA Karshen not in court. Case set for Scheduling Conference.  Case heard off the record. Defense counsel has prior appointment and was unable to wait for ADA Karshen to appear. Defense requests an adjourned Scheduling date. Court denied defense request and due to calendar congestion, ordered this matter scheduled for a Final Pretrial and Jury Trial date. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Parties to file motions by 04/01/2015. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Defense has received discovery and State's offer. State notified by the clerk of next court dates. Case adjourned to branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Allan M Rischman in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Ron Dague for Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP  
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 25.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: OAR ( dob: 12/27/2000)
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Allan M Rischman in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  
Defendant Allan M Rischman in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  
 Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
